revised_title: Quantum-Mechanical Interpretation of Electron-Transfer Processes in Aqueous Solutions
tldr: The article discusses the quantum-mechanical interpretation of electron-transfer processes in aqueous solutions. It considers the role of the solvent and the Frank-Condon principle, and provides a theoretical understanding of the mechanism and factors influencing the rate of electron transfer. The study covers non-adiabatic electron transfer, electron transfer by tunnel effect, and the energy differences between initial and final states.
